Audio Description: The United States Office of War Information issued the poster of a photograph of the five Sullivan brothers. The poster commemorates brothers who were missing in action during the Battle of Guadalcanal on November 13, 1942. The young, clean-shaven sailors from Waterloo, Iowa are pictured in the photo wearing dark pea coats and black berets with the words “U.S. Navy” over a slight brim. They are standing around a gray ship hatch. From left to right, the brothers are Joseph, Francis, Albert, Madison and George Sullivan. The poster has a thick red bordered under the photograph are the words reading “the five Sullivan brothers missing in action of the Solomon Islands.” Above each of the brothers in a white field is a blue star that serves as a symbol for a serviceman or woman missing in action. The brothers died in a submarine attack on the ship they were assigned to, the USS Juneau. At the bottom of the poster are the words: “They did their part.”
Creator: United States. Office of War Information
